title: Why did the Mongols invade Baghdad and almost destroyed a major part of Islamic culture? - Quora

response.answer_text: A story by Shaheen Bin Alam gives an indirect message to any disobedient people who neglect the ethical principles of God Almighty The daughter of HALAKO KHAN, the Mongol general who raided Baghdad, was once walking the streets of Baghdad when she noticed a crowd gathering around a man. She asked who he was and was told that he was a Muslim scholar. So she asked him to be summoned before her. When he arrived, she asked him, “Are you not the ones who believe in Allah?” He replied, “Of course.” She said, “Do you not claim that Allah supports and grants victory to whom He wills?” He replied, “Of course.” She said, “Has Allah not granted us victory over you?” He said, “Yes.” She said, “Does that not mean that we are more beloved to Allah than you?” He said, “No.” She asked, “Why?” He said, “Do you not know of the shepherd?” She replied, “Of course.” He said, “Aren’t there some dogs with his flock (of sheep)?” She said, “Yes.” He said, “What does the shepherd do when some of his flock wander off and leave his authority?” She said, “He sends his dogs to bring them back under his authority.” He said, “For how long do the dogs continue to chase after the sheep? ” She replied, “As long as they remain astray.” So he said, “O Tartars, you are the dogs of Allah( God Almighty) on His earth, and as long as we Muslims remain astray from the path and obedience of Allah, you will remain behind us until we return to Him!”
